metadata.Description: Ecological modernization refers to the process of integrating ecological principles and practices into modernization efforts.

relations.Description: Ecological modernization implements energy efficiency policies that promote sustainable energy practices.
Ecological modernization funds research on renewable energy technologies to support the transition to sustainable energy sources.
Ecological modernization focuses on promoting a circular economy that minimizes waste and maximizes resource efficiency.
Ecological modernization plays a crucial role in the sustainable energy transition by promoting renewable energy and sustainable practices.
Ecological modernization partners with clean energy companies to accelerate the adoption of sustainable energy solutions.
Ecological modernization contributes to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting sustainable energy practices and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Ecological modernization monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and promote energy efficiency.
Ecological modernization targets increased renewable energy generation to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and promote sustainable energy sources.
